reviews.review: this movie plot was rubbish all the jokes were horrible not worth seeing

When I saw all the reviews on Flixster and other websites I thought they were maybe being overly hard on this movie before I saw it. But now I can see it really is FUCKING AWFUL. It really is a massive advertisement. When product placement in a movie seems to take over a spot that character development, plot, and general quality are supposed to occupy in a good movie, you know you have some hot garbage. The only time I laughed during the whole movie is when the credits started to roll and I realized that I just wasted an hour and a half of my life watching "The Emoji Movie". The worst part of this movie is the writing. It is so dull and doesn't provoke any thoughts whatsoever like a normal Pixar movie would. I think I would hate this movie more if the animation wasn't the only thing that resembled quality. Do NOT waste your money seeing this steaming pile of shit.
the only film that has ever left me without words. possibly the worst film i have ever seen. what good is being number one if there aren't any other numbers?
This movie is terrible, I wanted to leave the theater. Although, my headache after watching the movie wasn't that bad.
Honestly such a disappointment. The characters are hateabke and punchable, they don't even look like emojis! But I'd send the human girl an emoji or two ????
this movie is the most cliche thing I have ever seen, also the jokes are awful and not one is remotely funny.

It genuinely feels like "The Emoji Movie" was made to appeal to those children born in the last 10 years who grew up with a smartphone permanently glued to their hand. That, or it's nothing more than a desperate money-grab. The premise of the movie is exactly what it sounds like: it's a story wherein the main protagonists are the cartoony figures found in every modern-day texting app: emojis (not to be confused with emoticons, which the movie makes out to be "the elderly"). This shtick gets old rather quickly (i.e. in the first couple of minutes), after which the tasteless jokes - if we may even categorise this kind of humour as such - keep coming, one even worse than the other. I never thought any amount of poop jokes could make me suicidal, yet here we are. If awful parodies on pop-culture media are the future for animation movies, then I will gladly never set foot in a theater to review one such films ever again.
I thought it was a cute and funny movie.
I expected this movie to bad, but I was wrong. It was worse! This is clearly a cash-grab on something in pop culture, what's next? A meme movie?
